title: NCIS: Tony & Ziva
reason: Premiering September 4, 2025, this highly anticipated spinoff reunites fan-favorite characters Tony DiNozzo and Ziva David as they go on the run across Europe while trying to protect their daughter. Perfect if you enjoy action-packed spy thrillers with established characters.

title: Alien: Earth
reason: This new sci-fi series in the iconic Alien franchise brings the terror of xenomorphs to Earth. If you enjoy thought-provoking sci-fi with elements of horror, this series offers both suspense and exploration of humanity's future.

title: Wednesday (Season 2, Part 2)
reason: You'll love the continuation of this gothic series as Wednesday Addams faces new supernatural mysteries at Nevermore Academy. The second half of season 2 just dropped on September 3rd, completing the cliffhanger from Part 1 with four thrilling final episodes.

title: Black Rabbit
reason: This limited series starring Jude Law and Jason Bateman premieres September 18th and is perfect for your taste in drama. Set in New York City's high-pressure nightlife scene, it follows two estranged brothers whose reunion leads to dangerous criminal entanglements.

title: The Runarounds
reason: From the creator of "Outer Banks," this musical teen drama follows recent high school graduates forming a rock band in Wilmington, North Carolina. All eight episodes dropped on September 1st, offering you a fresh coming-of-age story with an authentic soundtrack.

title: Gen V (Season 2)
reason: The spin-off of "The Boys" returns for its sophomore season on September 17th with three episodes at launch. You'll appreciate this darker superhero series that explores the next generation of supes at Godolkin University under Homelander's reign.

title: The Morning Show (Season 4)
reason: Premiering September 17th, the fourth season picks up two years after season 3's events, reuniting Jennifer Aniston and Reese Witherspoon. This Emmy-winning drama delivers the media industry intrigue and complex character dynamics you enjoy.

title: Slow Horses (Season 5)
reason: Gary Oldman returns as the cynical Jackson Lamb on September 24th in this critically acclaimed spy thriller. Based on Mick Herron's "London Rules" novel, the new season follows MI5's outcasts investigating terror plots in a destabilized London.

title: The Paper
reason: This spinoff from "The Office" premiered September 4th with all ten episodes available to binge. Set in the same mockumentary style, it follows Oscar from Dunder Mifflin as he joins a struggling Toledo newspaper, offering the workplace comedy you appreciate.

title: Marvel Zombies
reason: Premiering September 24th, this four-part animated series shows what happens when the Avengers are overtaken by a zombie plague. With voice talents including Elizabeth Olsen and Paul Rudd, it delivers a darker take on the Marvel universe you'll find refreshing.

title: House of Guinness
reason: This new historical drama from the creator of "Peaky Blinders" premieres September 25, 2025. You'll be captivated by this Succession-style story about the family behind the Guinness brewing empire in 19th-century Ireland, featuring power struggles and family drama with a stellar cast including Louis Partridge and Anthony Boyle.

title: Alice in Borderland (Season 3)
reason: The final season of this Japanese sci-fi thriller premieres September 25, 2025. If you enjoy high-stakes survival games with mind-bending twists, this critically acclaimed series delivers intense action and psychological drama in its conclusion, with all episodes releasing at once.

title: The Savant
reason: This new limited series starring Jessica Chastain premieres September 26, 2025. You'll be gripped by this tense thriller about an undercover investigator infiltrating online hate groups to stop domestic extremists, with new episodes weekly through November 7.

title: Tulsa King (Season 3)
reason: Sylvester Stallone returns as Dwight Manfredi on September 21, 2025. This season, you'll see his empire rise to new heights as he faces his most dangerous enemies yet—the influential old-money Dunmire family, with Robert Patrick joining as patriarch Jeremiah Dunmire.

title: Love Con Revenge
reason: This new reality series premieres September 5, 2025. If you enjoyed "The Tinder Swindler," you'll appreciate this show where victims of romance scams team up with Tinder Swindler target Cecilie Fjellhøy and a private investigator for confrontations and justice.

title: The Great British Baking Show (Collection 13)
reason: The beloved baking competition returns September 5, 2025, with Paul Hollywood, Prue Leith, Noel Fielding, and Alison Hammond. You'll enjoy this relaxing, feel-good show featuring a new batch of amateur bakers competing in the iconic tent with weekly episodes.

title: Chad Powers
reason: This comedy series starring Glen Powell premieres September 30, 2025. Based on Eli Manning's viral character, you'll laugh as a disgraced quarterback reinvents himself under the alias "Chad Powers" in a desperate bid for redemption as a walk-on player.

title: Hotel Costiera
reason: This action-drama series starring Jesse Williams premieres September 24, 2025. Set on the stunning Amalfi Coast, you'll follow a former Marine working as a fixer at a luxury hotel while searching for the owner's missing daughter, with all six episodes releasing at once.

title: Tyler Perry's Beauty in Black (Season 2)
reason: The second season of this popular drama returns September 11, 2025. You'll be drawn into the power struggles of the Bellarie family in this emotional, suspenseful soap opera that combines family drama with high-stakes business conflicts.

title: Dexter: Resurrection (Season Finale)
reason: The season finale of this crime drama mystery premieres September 5, 2025. You'll see the conclusion of Dexter Morgan's latest chapter as Michael C. Hall's iconic character faces the consequences of his actions in this thrilling sequel series.
